content.description:
This is a fun problem that could be bouldered if you are solid.  It's probably wiser to TR it.  It is the overhang in the area that draws your eye & asks to be climbed. 

  You can scramble up to the roof easily.  Then, the question is what next.  Long reach, then brute force or heel hook high & right.  Once you get it, you may praise your rope & belayer or wish you were braver.  Not a gimme.
content.location: This is the obvious roof of the Pinnacle Wall.

content.description: Start as for the Top Eliminator, but veer left under the big overhang.
content.location: This is under the big overhang at the Eliminator Roof and uses the same start as the Top Eliminator route.

content.description:
The Eliminator Roof in the Pinnacle Area has a small set problems that are probably no more than 15 feet tall with a neat roof problem. In reality, it is really close and linked to Pinnacle Wall, but a MP.com user suggested it would be helpful to split it out to its own subarea. While this is a short rock, a toprope is advisable until you have these wired, especially the Eliminator Roof.

 The GPS coordinates are not correct yet.

 Per Curtis Tripp: beware of poison ivy.
